result.title: Database and models for soil type specific trafficability
result.description: Based on existing models and experiments, models that predict rutting and compaction during typical forest operations will be defined. These models will take into account in one hand soil bearing capacity and hydraulic transfer properties (previous deliverable) and in other hand the stress distribution at the tyre/track-soil interface. Finally, long term effects of forest traffic on soil functioning will be assessed: the resilience of soil to compaction, or conversely, the persistence of soil compaction, and their consequences on soil functions (including hydraulic transfer functions). Results will serve as a correction factor in the parametrization of the hydrological model.
